lines.text:
[of a football player in a tuxedo]
Now who says that clothes don't make the man? That's a well-dressed phone booth!
Assholes! Ass. Holes! You're all assholes, every one of you. Your lives don't work!
Shake, old buddy, you know what I'm choosing to do?
What?
I am choosing to win this fucking game.

[responding to a knock at the bathroom door]
Just shit and push it under the door.

[to another knock at the bathroom door]
Go shit in your hat!
Why are you getting married? Did she knock you up?
You ain't gonna let me have it, are you, Lord? I'm a sinner and you're gonna fuck me.

[Billy Clyde is being "pelfed" and Clara Pelf is pulling on a rubber glove]
Oh no... I remember *that* from the Army!
What you got is a bad case of Barbara Jane Bookman!
I've always had that. I just didn't know how bad until now.

[realizing what Billy Clyde is up to and laughing]
Oh man... you don't really think you're going to pull this scam off, do you?
I'm sure gonna give it my best shot.

[they're watching the wedding degenerate into a brawl]
Friedrich is right about one thing... I sure am an asshole.
Friedrich is an asshole.

[raises her veil and stares at him]
Say that again?

[deliberately]
Friedrich is an asshole.

[incredulous]
You didn't get *it*?
In the immortal words of Gene Autry... nope.

[realizing]
You son-of-a...
